title: Extreme weather sweeps across Australia | 7NEWS
description: Severe weather events are impacting both ends of Australia simultaneously. Victoria faces catastrophic bushfire conditions with winds up to 100km/h and temperatures in the 40s, forcing evacuations in dozens of towns including Longwood and areas near Seymour, marking the first catastrophic fire rating since the 2019 Black Summer bushfires. Queensland is bracing for a potential cyclone with a 45% chance of formation off the far north coast, threatening to bring over half a metre of rainfall and wind gusts exceeding 90km/h, with particular concern for already flood-affected regions. title: Teenage girl killed in Sydney's southwest crash | 7NEWS
description: A fatal collision between a Toyota Hilux and Mazda sedan in Appen, Sydney's southwest, has claimed the life of a 17-year-old girl. The crash occurred around 8pm, leaving a 46-year-old man and 30-year-old woman in critical condition, while a 12-year-old boy sustained minor injuries. Police investigations into the incident are ongoing. title: Multiple boats destroyed in Spit Bridge Marina fire | 7NEWS
description: A major fire broke out at Spit Bridge Marina in Mosman, Sydney's north shore, at approximately 3:30am, engulfing four vessels in flames. One yacht has sunk and another is destroyed and expected to sink, while four people were treated for smoke inhalation at the scene. Forty firefighters responded to the emergency at the marina. title: Fatal shooting during ICE raid sparks political firestorm | 7NEWS
description: An immigration enforcement officer fatally shot a mother of three in Minnesota during an ICE operation, sparking political controversy. The Trump administration claims self-defence whilst local officials, including Governor Tim Walz, accuse the agency of creating chaos. The incident has intensified partisan debate over the administration's aggressive immigration enforcement policies, with footage of the shooting available from multiple angles yet no consensus on culpability. title: Boats go up in flames at Spit Bridge Marina
description: A fire has broken out at the Spit Bridge Marina in Mosman, engulfing numerous luxury yachts and causing three to sink. It is as yet unknown what caused the blaze. #fire #boatfire #spitbridge #spitbridgemarina #mosman

title: Multiple fires burning out of control in Victoria
description: Authorities are warning of unsurvivable conditions in Victoria as another day of over 40-degree temperatures fans two out-of-control fires in the state. #fire #bushfire #victoria #firefighter #heatwave

title: Cyclone threat intensifies off Qld coast
description: The Bureau of Meteorology says there is a 45 per cent chance a tropical low off the coast of Queensland will become a cyclone by the weekend, with a possible landfall north of Townsville. #cyclone #queensland #qld #tropicalstorm #storm

title: Denmark pushes back against US aggression over Greenland
description: Denmark is pushing back against US aggression, calling for a meeting with leaders to oppose Donald Trump's bid to control Greenland. #greenland #denmark #trump #usa #whitehouse

description: PM calls a Commonwealth Royal Commission into anti-Semitism. title: Major yacht fire destroys three vessels at Spit Bridge Marina | 7NEWS
description: A major fire broke out at the Spit Bridge Marina in Mosman at 3.30am, destroying three luxury yachts that subsequently sank. Approximately 40 firefighters from 12 fire trucks battled the blaze for two hours, successfully preventing it from spreading to dozens of other moored vessels. Four people were assessed for smoke inhalation, and authorities are now managing hazardous materials including oils and fuels from the sunken vessels using containment booms. title: 'We might lose the lot': Emotional farmer flees catastrophic bushfire threat | 7NEWS
description: A fifth-generation sheep farmer from Yark evacuates to a relief centre as catastrophic fire conditions threaten his property. Bob describes leaving behind his merino sheep, along with generations of breeding work dating back to his grandfather's arrival in 1908. He evacuated with five dogs while his family's farm faces potential destruction from the raging fires. title: 'Lives will be lost' during extreme heatwave, NSW Premier Chris Minns says
description: "Lives will be lost" due to extreme heat on Saturday, NSW Premier Chris Minns says. The Sydney CBD is forecast to reach 42C as the heatwave peaks across parts of the state, while firefighters head across the border to assist teams battling the disaster in Victoria. #heat #heatwave #weather #sydney #nsw
